intro: Heliosperma veselskyi, commonly known as the "sun spurge," is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and striking yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in botanical studies.
